intro: Tithymalus schugnanicus, commonly known as the Schugnanic tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, attract various pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tithymalus schugnanicus is considered a species of conservation concern.
